famous_person.name: Whitney Houston
famous_person.description: Singer and actor Whitney was widely regarded as having one of the best voices of all time

famous_person.name: Amy Winehouse
famous_person.description: Amy was best known for her explosive vocals and expressive songwriting

famous_person.name: Elvis Presely
famous_person.description: American singer and actor Known as the king of Rock and Roll

famous_person.name: Queen Elizabeth�II
famous_person.description: Elizabeth was a queen of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms

famous_person.name: Mother Teresa
famous_person.description: Albanian-Indian church nun, Noble peace prize winner, saint and a selfless missionary of charity

famous_person.name: Micheal Jackson
famous_person.description: American singer-songwriter and dancer. Jackson is one of the bestselling music artists of all time

famous_person.name: Albert Einstein
famous_person.description: Theoretical physicist, Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist who is widely held to be one of the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

famous_person.name: Bob Marley
famous_person.description: Jamaican singer and guitarist, Robert Nesta Marley OM was a Jamaican reggae singer, guitarist, and songwriter

famous_person.name: Tupac Shukar
famous_person.description: American rapper Tupac Amaru Shakur, also known by his stage names 2Pac and Makaveli, was an American rapper. He is widely considered one of the most influential and successful rappers of all time

famous_person.name: Marilyn Monroe
famous_person.description: American actress and model, She became one of the world's most enduring iconic figures and is remembered both for her winsome embodiment of the Hollywood sex symbol and her tragic personal and professional struggles within the film industry

famous_person.name: Adolf Hitler
famous_person.description: Adolf Hitler was an Austrian-born German politician who was the dictator of Germany from 1933 until his suicide in 1945. He rose to power as the leader of the Nazi Party, becoming the chancellor in 1933 and then taking the title of Führer und Reichskanzler in 1934

famous_person.name: Akira Toriyama
famous_person.description: Akira Toriyama was a Japanese manga artist and character designer. He first achieved mainstream recognition for creating the popular manga series Dr. Slump, before going on to create Dragon Ball Z

famous_person.name: Mac Miller
famous_person.description: Malcolm James McCormick, known professionally as Mac Miller, was an American rapper, singer-songwriter, and record producer

famous_person.name: Goerge Ohm
famous_person.description: Georg Simon Ohm was a German physicist and mathematician. As a schoolteacher, Ohm began his research with the new electrochemical cell, invented by Italian scientist Alessandro Volta

famous_person.name: Leonardo Da Vinci
famous_person.description: Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci was an Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who was active as a painter, draughtsman, engineer, scientist, theorist, sculptor, and architect

famous_person.name: Chadwick Boseman
famous_person.description: Malcolm James McCormick, known professionally as Mac Miller, was an American rapper, singer-songwriter, and record producer

famous_person.name: Kobe Bryant
famous_person.description: Lakers basketball player NBA champ known for serving hoops in his team called the Lakers

famous_person.name: Nelson Mandela
famous_person.description: Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela was a South African anti-apartheid activist and politician who served as the first president of South Africa from 1994 to 1999. He was the country's first black head of state and the first elected in a fully representative democratic election

famous_person.name: Goerge Washington
famous_person.description: George Washington was an American Founding Father, military officer, and politician who served as the first president of the United States from 1789 to 1797

famous_person.name: Abraham Lincon
famous_person.description: Abraham Lincoln was an American lawyer, politician, and statesman who served as the 16th president of the United States from 1861 until his assassination in 1865

famous_person.name: Winnie Mandela
famous_person.description: Winnie Madikizela-Mandela OLS MP also known as Winnie Mandela, was a South African anti-apartheid activist and politician, and the second wife of Nelson Mandela

famous_person.name: Avicii
famous_person.description: Tim Bergling, known professionally as Avicii, was a Swedish record producer. At age 16, Bergling began posting his remixes on electronic music forums, which led to his first record deal. He rose to prominence in 2011 with his single Levels

famous_person.name: Matthew Perry
famous_person.description: Matthew Langford Perry was an American and Canadian actor. He gained international fame for starring as Chandler Bing on the NBC television sitcom Friends. Perry also appeared on Ally McBeal and received Primetime Emmy Award nominations

famous_person.name: Cameron Boyce
famous_person.description: Cameron Mica Boyce was an American actor. He began his career as a child actor, appearing in the 2008 films Mirrors and Eagle Eye, along with the comedy film Grown Ups and its 2013 sequel. His first starring role was on the Disney Channel comedy series Jessie

famous_person.name: Takeoff
famous_person.description: Kirsnick Khari Ball, known professionally as Takeoff, was an American rapper. He was best known as the youngest member of the hip hop group Migos along with his uncle Quavo and close affiliate Offset

famous_person.name: Pablo Picasso
famous_person.description: Pablo Ruiz Picasso was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, and theatre designer who spent most of his adult life in France.

famous_person.name: Vincent Van Gogh
famous_person.description: Vincent Willem van Gogh was a Dutch Post-Impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art. In just over a decade he created approximately 2100 artworks, including around 860 oil paintings

famous_person.name: Aaliyah
famous_person.description: Aaliyah Dana Haughton was an American singer and actress. She has been credited with helping to redefine contemporary R&B, pop, and hip hop, earning her the nicknames the Princess of R&B and Queen of Urban Pop

famous_person.name: AKA
famous_person.description: Kiernan Jarryd Forbes, known professionally as AKA, was a South African rapper, record producer, and businessman. Born in Cape Town and raised in Johannesburg, Forbes gained recognition after releasing his single Victory Lap from his debut studio album, Alter Ego.

famous_person.name: Naya Rivera
famous_person.description: Naya Marie Rivera was an American actress, singer, and model. Recognized for her work on the popular musical comedy-drama series Glee which she starred from 2009 to 2015. She received various awards, including a Screen Actors Guild Award and nominations for two Grammy Awards

famous_person.name: Isaac Newton
famous_person.description: Sir Isaac Newton was an English polymath active as a mathematician, physicist, astronomer, alchemist theologist and author who was described in his time as a natural philosopher.
